00047 fsal_status_t FSAL_readlink(
00048     fsal_handle_t         * p_linkhandle,     /* IN */
00049     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00050     fsal_path_t           * p_link_content, /* OUT */
00051     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_link_attributes /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00052 ){
00053 
00054   int rc, errsv;
00055   fsal_status_t status;
00056   char link_content_out[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00057   fsal_path_t               fsalpath;
00058 
00059  /* sanity checks.
00060   * note : link_attributes is optional.
00061   */
00062   if (!p_linkhandle || !p_context || !p_link_content)
00063     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00064     
00065   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_linkhandle, 0, &fsalpath, NULL);
00066   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00067   
00068   memset(link_content_out, 0, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00069   
00070   /* Read the link on the filesystem */
00071   
00072   TakeTokenFSCall();
00073   rc = readlink(fsalpath.path, link_content_out, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00074   errsv = errno;
00075   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00076   
00077   /* rc is the length for the symlink content or -1 on error !!! */  
00078   if (rc<0)
00079     Return( posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00080     
00081   /* convert char * to fsal_path_t */
00082   
00083   status = FSAL_str2path(link_content_out, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, p_link_content);
00084   
00085   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00086     Return(status.major, status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00087     
00088   
00089   /* retrieves object attributes, if asked */
00090   
00091   if ( p_link_attributes ){
00092     
00093     status = FSAL_getattrs( p_linkhandle, p_context , p_link_attributes );
00094     
00095     /* On error, we set a flag in the returned attributes */
00096     
00097     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00098     {
00099       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes );
00100       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes,
00101           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00102     }
00103     
00104   }
00105   
00106   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_readlink );
00107   
00108   
00109 }

00142 fsal_status_t FSAL_symlink(
00143     fsal_handle_t         * p_parent_directory_handle,    /* IN */
00144     fsal_name_t           * p_linkname,                 /* IN */
00145     fsal_path_t           * p_linkcontent,              /* IN */
00146     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00147     fsal_accessmode_t       accessmode,                 /* IN (ignored) */
00148     fsal_handle_t         * p_link_handle,                /* OUT */
00149     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_link_attributes             /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00150 ){
00151 
00152   int rc, errsv;
00153   fsal_status_t status;
00154   fsal_path_t   fsalpath;
00155   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t infofs;
00156   struct stat buffstat;
00157   
00158   /* sanity checks.
00159    * note : link_attributes is optional.
00160    */
00161   if ( !p_parent_directory_handle || 
00162        !p_context   ||
00163        !p_link_handle ||
00164        !p_linkname  ||
00165        !p_linkcontent )
00166     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00167   
00168   /* Tests if symlinking is allowed by configuration. */
00169   
00170   if ( !global_fs_info.symlink_support )
00171       Return( ERR_FSAL_NOTSUPP, 0,INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00172 
00173   
00174   /* build the new path and check the permissions on the parent directory */
00175   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_parent_directory_handle, 1, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00176   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00177   
00178   status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK, &buffstat, NULL);
00179   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00180   
00181   status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath, p_linkname);
00182   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00183   
00184   /* create the symlink on the filesystem. */
00185   
00186   TakeTokenFSCall();
00187   rc = symlink(p_linkcontent->path, fsalpath.path);
00188   errsv = errno;
00189   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00190 
00191   if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00192 
00193   /* stat the file & add it to the database */ 
00194   TakeTokenFSCall();
00195   rc = lstat( fsalpath.path, &buffstat );
00196   errsv = errno;
00197   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00198 
00199   if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00200 
00201   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &infofs) ) )
00202     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00203   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR (status = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn, p_linkname, &infofs, p_parent_directory_handle, p_link_handle)))
00204     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00205   
00206   /* chown the symlink to the current user */
00207 
00208   TakeTokenFSCall();
00209   rc = lchown(fsalpath.path, p_context->credential.user, -1);
00210   errsv = errno;
00211   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00212   
00213   if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00214 
00215   /* get attributes if asked */
00216   
00217   if ( p_link_attributes ){
00218     
00219     status = posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat, p_link_attributes );
00220     
00221     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00222     {
00223         FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes );
00224         FSAL_SET_MASK( p_link_attributes->asked_attributes,
00225             FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00226     }
00227     
00228   }
00229   
00230   
00231   /* OK */
00232   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00233 }
